apiClassifier.shortdesc: Dispatched by a Task to indicated a change in state.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched by a Task to indicated a change in state.

apiValue.shortdesc: Optional data object related to the Task dispatching this event.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Optional data object related to the Task dispatching this event. If the event is an error event this object may also contain more information about the error.

apiValue.shortdesc: Optional human-readable message.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Optional human-readable message.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Dispatched by TaskManager to indicate a change in state.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched by TaskManager to indicate a change in state.

apiParam.apiDesc: Errored task (if event type is ERROR)

apiValue.shortdesc: Optional human-readable message.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Optional human-readable message.

apiValue.shortdesc: Task associated with error (in the event of an error).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Task associated with error (in the event of an error).

apiClassifier.shortdesc: An interruptible Task can be paused and resumed after being run.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
An interruptible Task can be paused and resumed after being run.
Pausing a non-running Task should have no effect. Resuming a non-interrupted Task should have no effect.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If an interrupting-Task has been provided (via interruptForTask) this Task will automatically resume when it completes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If an interrupting-Task has been provided (via interruptForTask) this Task will automatically resume when it completes. This method to cancels that behavior by removing references and event listeners.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Interrupts the current Task to wait on the Task specified.

apiReturn.apiDesc: TRUE if the Task has been successfully interrupted

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interrupts the current Task to wait on the Task specified. Once this Task dispatches a TaskEvent.COMPLETE event, this Task will resume. If the specified Task dispatches a TaskEvent.ERROR event this Task will also error. TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED events are ignored.
If this method is called once with a Task and then called again before that Task has completed, Event listeners will be removed from the first Task and added to the second one. There can only be 1 active interrupting Task at a time. If this Task should be interrupted by more than one Task, a CompositeTask or ObserverTask should be used.
If the specified interrupting Task is already running this method will simply add event listeners. If it is not running this method will add event listeners but will rely on external code to run the interrupter.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Interrupt the current Task.

apiReturn.apiDesc: TRUE if the Task has been successfully interrupted

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interrupt the current Task. Interruptions should be handled in such a way as to allow a subsequent call to run() to resume gracefully.
This mehtod should trigger an event of type TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Although Tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate interruption this method may also be used for notification purposes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Although Tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate interruption this method may also be used for notification purposes. The provided function will be invoked only upon interruption of the Task.
This method may be called multiple times safely; each unique function specified will be executed once if the task interrupts.
It should have one of the following signatures: function( message:String = "", data:= null ):void function():void

apiValue.shortdesc: The Task currently interrupting the this Task's execution (or NULL if no such Task exists).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The Task currently interrupting the this Task's execution (or NULL if no such Task exists).

apiValue.shortdesc: The task has been interrupted and has not yet resumed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The task has been interrupted and has not yet resumed.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Decorates a Task and enforces a max-execution time limit.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Decorates a Task and enforces a max-execution time limit. If specified time interval elapses before the decorated Task has complete it is considered to be an error. The decorated Task will be interrupted (if possible) in that event.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiValue.shortdesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Special interface for tasks that decorate other tasks.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Special interface for tasks that decorate other tasks. This interface can assist external code in getting to the lowest-level failing task in the event of an error.

apiValue.shortdesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Task that loads a URLRequest and exposes the URLLoader's "urlLoaderData" upon success.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Task that loads a URLRequest and exposes the URLLoader's "urlLoaderData" upon success.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiValue.shortdesc: Loaded data.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Loaded data. This should only be accessed after the Task has completed.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is an abstract class and should not be instantiated directly.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This is an abstract class and should not be instantiated directly. Instead use one of the following sub-classes: TaskManager, InterruptibleTaskManager

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a task to the graph and set its dependencies.

apiException.apiDesc: if TaskManager has been configured for interruptible-mode and Task is not either interruptible or synchronous

apiParam.apiDesc: Array of Tasks that newly added Task depends on

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Adds a task to the graph and set its dependencies.
If TaskManager is currently running and the specified Taks has invalid dependencies, an ERROR event will be dispatched immediately.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Interruptible tasks should override interrupt() and get interruptible() if they are interruptible.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interruptible tasks should override interrupt() and get interruptible() if they are interruptible.
If they are, they should fire a TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED to indicate successful interruption of the task.
If the interrupting fails at runtime, this method returns false

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a task from the task manager.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes a task from the task manager.
If the TaskManager is running and this operation unblocks any of the remaining Tasks, they will be executed as a result of this removal.

apiValue.shortdesc: There are no pending or active Tasks.

asCustoms.internal: This method is left around for backwards compatibility purposes only.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: There are no pending or active Tasks.

apiValue.shortdesc: Error datas from all inner Tasks that failed during execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Error datas from all inner Tasks that failed during execution.

apiValue.shortdesc: Unique error messages from all inner Tasks that failed during execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Unique error messages from all inner Tasks that failed during execution.

apiValue.shortdesc: Tasks that errored during execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Tasks that errored during execution.

apiValue.shortdesc: The current Task can be interrupted.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current Task can be interrupted. Invoking interrupt() for a Task that is not marked as interruptible may result in an error.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of Tasks that have successfully completed execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of Tasks that have successfully completed execution.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of internal operations that have completed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of internal operations that have completed. Sub-classes should override this method if containing a value > 1;

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of internal operations conducted by this task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Number of internal operations conducted by this task. Sub-classes should override this method if containing a value > 1;
If value > 1, task should dispatch ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events manually to indicate changes in numInternalOperationsCompleted. If value == 1, task will automatically dispatching ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of Tasks to be executed by TaskManager.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of Tasks to be executed by TaskManager.

apiValue.shortdesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Wraps a set of IInterruptibleTask (or ISynchronousTask) and executes them in parallel or serial, as specified by a boolean constructor arg.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Wraps a set of IInterruptibleTask (or ISynchronousTask) and executes them in parallel or serial, as specified by a boolean constructor arg. Interruptable composite task designed to be paused and resumed gracefully and automatically handles interrupting and resuming all child tasks.

asCustoms.para: taskIdentifier Human friendly identifier for Task

apiException.apiDesc: if tasksOrFunctions Array contains object that is not either an IInterruptibleTask, ISynchronousTask, or a Function

apiParam.apiDesc: Set of Tasks and/or functions to be executed
When TRUE, execute all tasks and report if all succeed (COMPLETE) or not (ERROR) When FALSE, execute tasks in order. Do not execute subsequent tasks if one fails.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute. Additional tasks may be safely at any time (including while the CompositeTask is executing). Tasks are added to the end, so in serial tasks, tasks added later will not be run if an earlier one fails.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute. Additional tasks may be safely at any time (including while the CompositeTask is executing). Tasks are added to the end, so in serial tasks, tasks added later will not be run if an earlier one fails.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Task that delays for a specified time before completion.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Task that delays for a specified time before completion.
This task supports interruption as well as resume. Upon resuming an interrupted Wait this Task can either re-start the Timer at the beginning or resume from the interrupted point. This behavior can be controlled via the constructor parameter "restartTimerAfterInterruption".

apiParam.apiDesc: Number of milliseconds Task should wait before completing

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of milliseconds Task should wait before completing.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of milliseconds Task should wait before completing.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A synchronous Task is one that completes immediately upon being run.

asCustoms.internal: This interface is a useful placeholder even though it does not define any additional API methods.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A synchronous Task is one that completes immediately upon being run.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Manages execution of a set of ITasks.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Manages execution of a set of ITasks. Tasks may specify blocking depencies on other tasks. This class will wrap all TaskEvents and dispatch TaskManagerEvent.COMPLETE only once all Tasks have completed. If a task errors, this class will dispatch a TaskManagerEvent.ERROR event and halt running any additional tasks.

apiParam.apiDesc: Consider using InterruptibleTaskManager instead of this parameter.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a task to the graph and set its dependencies.

apiException.apiDesc: if TaskManager has been configured for interruptible-mode and Task is not either interruptible or synchronous

apiParam.apiDesc: Array of Tasks that newly added Task depends on

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Adds a task to the graph and set its dependencies.
If TaskManager is currently running and the specified Taks has invalid dependencies, an ERROR event will be dispatched immediately.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a task from the task manager.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes a task from the task manager.
If the TaskManager is running and this operation unblocks any of the remaining Tasks, they will be executed as a result of this removal.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Manages execution of a set of IInterruptibleTasks.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Manages execution of a set of IInterruptibleTasks. Tasks may specify blocking depencies on other tasks. This class will wrap all TaskEvents and dispatch TaskManagerEvent.COMPLETE only once all Tasks have completed. If a task errors, this class will dispatch a TaskManagerEvent.ERROR event and halt running any additional tasks.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a task to the graph and set its dependencies.

apiException.apiDesc: if TaskManager has been configured for interruptible-mode and Task is not either interruptible or synchronous

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Adds a task to the graph and set its dependencies.
If TaskManager is currently running and the specified Taks has invalid dependencies, an ERROR event will be dispatched immediately.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a task from the task manager.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Removes a task from the task manager.
If the TaskManager is running and this operation unblocks any of the remaining Tasks, they will be executed as a result of this removal.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Used for retrieving information about the TaskManager component.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the build version number of this component.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the build version number of this component.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the major version number of this component.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the major version number of this component.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the minor version number of this component.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the minor version number of this component.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a string with the three version numbers, seperated by '.' - e.g.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns a string with the three version numbers, seperated by '.' - e.g. 3.1.2 or 0.1.23

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Wraps a set of ITasks and executes them in parallel or serial, as specified by a boolean constructor arg.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Wraps a set of ITasks and executes them in parallel or serial, as specified by a boolean constructor arg.

asCustoms.para: taskIdentifier Human friendly identifier for Task

apiException.apiDesc: if tasksOrFunctions Array contains object that is not a Task or a Function

apiParam.apiDesc: Set of Tasks and/or functions to be executed
When TRUE, execute all tasks and report if all succeed (COMPLETE) or not (ERROR) When FALSE, execute tasks in order. Do not execute subsequent tasks if one fails.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute. Additional tasks may be safely at any time (including while the CompositeTask is executing). Tasks are added to the end, so in serial tasks, tasks added later will not be run if an earlier one fails.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Special Task decorator for Tasks that should be retried on failure.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Special Task decorator for Tasks that should be retried on failure. (For example, this could be useful for Tasks that rely on an internet connection in order to complete.)
This task allows its decorated Task to fail a couple of times before bubbling the error. A small amount of time is allowed to pass between each retry. This delay allows time for an external monitor to detect a loss of internet connection and pause all Tasks until it is restored. It also allows for a more graceful handling of occasional HTTP failures.

apiParam.apiDesc: Ideally this Task should be interruptible; if not it will be wrapped in a InterruptibleDecoratorTask to simulate interruptibility
Optional human-readible Task ID (useful for debug purposes only)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes may override this method to determine of a failed Task should be retried.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes may override this method to determine of a failed Task should be retried. This decision is separate from the normal max-retry counting logic. By default this function always returns TRUE.

apiValue.shortdesc: The amount of time to delay before resetting and re-running the decorated Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The amount of time to delay before resetting and re-running the decorated Task. This value should probably only be overriden for unit test purposes. A value of <= 0 seconds will result in a synchronous retry.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of times to reset and re-run the decorated Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of times to reset and re-run the decorated Task. This value should probably only be overriden for unit test purposes. A value of <= 0 will cause a single failure to trigger a bubbled failure.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interrupt the current Task. Interruptions should be handled in such a way as to allow a subsequent call to run() to resume gracefully.
This mehtod should trigger an event of type TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current Task can be interrupted. Invoking interrupt() for a Task that is not marked as interruptible may result in an error.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Task that plays a Sound and completes when the sound has finished playing.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Task that plays a Sound and completes when the sound has finished playing. This Task expects that the Sound object provided has already been loaded.
This task supports interruption as well as resume. Upon resuming an interrupted Sound this Task can either re-start playback at the beginning or resume from the interrupted point. This behavior can be controlled via the constructor parameter "restartSoundAfterInterruption".

apiParam.apiDesc: Loaded Sound object to be played

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiParam.apiDesc: Component to wait for initialization from

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Empty Task useful primarily for unit testing.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Empty Task useful primarily for unit testing. It can also be useful in factory situations when a default no-op behavior is desired. If certain implementations wish to provide behavior they can replace the placeholder Stub task with one that does work.
This Task can be configured to auto-complete when it is executed. Otherwise it will not complete or error unless/until specifically told to do so.

apiParam.apiDesc: If TRUE Task will synchronously complete when it is run
Semantically meaningful task identifier (useful for automated testing or debugging)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Instructs Task to complete itself.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Instructs Task to complete itself.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is an abstract class and should not be instantiated directly.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This is an abstract class and should not be instantiated directly. Instead use one of the following sub-classes: CompositeTask, InterruptibleCompositeTask

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a function to the queue of Tasks by wrapping it inside of a TaskWithClosure.

apiParam.apiDesc: Unique identifier for function (and its TaskWithClosure)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds a function to the queue of Tasks by wrapping it inside of a TaskWithClosure. Functions added this way must be synchronous. This method is simply a convenience method for creating a TaskWithClosure and calling addTask().

apiException.apiDesc: if any of the specified parameters is not a Task or a Function

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds multiple Tasks or Functions to the internal set. This method is a convenience mehtod for calling addTask() or addFunction() multiple times.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds another task to the internal set that this class will execute. Additional tasks may be safely at any time (including while the CompositeTask is executing). Tasks are added to the end, so in serial tasks, tasks added later will not be run if an earlier one fails.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes may override this method to J.I.T. add child Tasks before the composite Task is run.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Convenience method for handling a completed Task and executing the next.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to be notified when individual Tasks have successfully completed.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to be notified when individual Tasks are started.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Interruptible tasks should override interrupt() and get interruptible() if they are interruptible.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interruptible tasks should override interrupt() and get interruptible() if they are interruptible.
If they are, they should fire a TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED to indicate successful interruption of the task.
If the interrupting fails at runtime, this method returns false

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a function from the queue of Tasks by locating its corresponding TaskWithClosure.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes a function from the queue of Tasks by locating its corresponding TaskWithClosure. This method is simply a convenience method for locating the matching Task and calling removeTask().

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes multiple Tasks or Functions from the internal set.

apiException.apiDesc: if any of the specified parameters is not a Task or a Function

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes multiple Tasks or Functions from the internal set. This method is a convenience mehtod for calling removeTask() or removeFunction() multiple times.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Convenience method for removing TaskEvent listeners from a Task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Convenience method for removing TaskEvent listeners from a Task.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a task from the internal set that this class will execute.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes a task from the internal set that this class will execute. If the specified Task has not been executed before it is removed it will not be executed by the CompositeTask.

apiValue.shortdesc: No incomplete Tasks remain in the queue.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: No incomplete Tasks remain in the queue.

apiValue.shortdesc: References the Task that is currently running (if this CompositeTask has been told to execute in serial).

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: References the Task that is currently running (if this CompositeTask has been told to execute in serial).

apiValue.shortdesc: Error datas from all inner Tasks that failed during execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Error datas from all inner Tasks that failed during execution. This value is valid after during execution of the CompositeTask as well as upon completion (or failure).

apiValue.shortdesc: Unique error messages from all inner Tasks that failed during execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Unique error messages from all inner Tasks that failed during execution. This value is valid after during execution of the CompositeTask as well as upon completion (or failure).

apiValue.shortdesc: Tasks that errored during execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Tasks that errored during execution. This value is valid after during execution of the CompositeTask as well as upon completion (or failure).

apiValue.shortdesc: The current Task can be interrupted.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current Task can be interrupted. Invoking interrupt() for a Task that is not marked as interruptible may result in an error.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of inner Tasks that have successfully completed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of inner Tasks that have successfully completed. This value is only valid while the CompositeTask is running. Upon completion (or failure) of the CompositeTask this value will be reset to 0.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of internal operations that have completed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of internal operations that have completed. Sub-classes should override this method if containing a value > 1;

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of internal operations conducted by this task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Number of internal operations conducted by this task. Sub-classes should override this method if containing a value > 1;
If value > 1, task should dispatch ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events manually to indicate changes in numInternalOperationsCompleted. If value == 1, task will automatically dispatching ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of inner Tasks that have been started and have not yet completed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of inner Tasks that have been started and have not yet completed. This value is only valid while the CompositeTask is running (or before it has been started). Upon completion (or failure) of the CompositeTask this value will be reset to 0.

apiValue.shortdesc: Number of inner Tasks.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Number of inner Tasks. This value is only valid while the CompositeTask is running (or before it has been started). Upon completion (or failure) of the CompositeTask this value will be reset to 0.

apiValue.shortdesc: Tasks currently in the process of being executed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Tasks currently in the process of being executed. This value is only valid while the CompositeTask is running (or before it has been started). Upon completion (or failure) of the CompositeTask this value will be reset to 0.

apiValue.shortdesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A Task represents a job.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A Task represents a job. This job can be synchronous or asynchronous. It can be a simple operation or a composite of other Tasks. This interface defines the minimum API that must be implemented by a Task within the Task Manager framework.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Executes the specified tasks when the current task is executed.

apiException.apiDesc: if any parameter is not a task

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Executes the specified tasks when the current task is executed. If the current task has already been started the new tasks will be executed immediately. Failures or interruptions in the current task will not affect the chained tasks.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Executes the specified tasks if the current task fails.

apiException.apiDesc: if any parameter is not a task

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Executes the specified tasks if the current task fails.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Resets the task to it's pre-run state.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Resets the task to it's pre-run state. This allows it to be re-run. This method can only be called on non-running tasks.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Starts a task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Starts a task. This method will dispatch a TaskEvent.STARTED to indicate that the task has begun.
This method may also be used to retry/resume an errored task.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Executes the specified tasks once the current task has completed successfully.

apiException.apiDesc: if any parameter is not a task

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Executes the specified tasks once the current task has completed successfully.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate completion, this method may also be used for notification purposes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate completion, this method may also be used for notification purposes. The provided function will be invoked only upon successful completion of the task.
This method may be called multiple times safely; each unique function specified will be executed once when the task completes.
It should have one of the following signatures: function( message:String = "", data:= null ):void function():void

apiOperation.shortdesc: Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate failure, this method may also be used for notification purposes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate failure, this method may also be used for notification purposes. The provided function will be invoked only upon failure of the task.
This method may be called multiple times safely; each unique function specified will be executed once if the tasks errors.
It should have one of the following signatures: function( message:String = "", data:= null ):void function():void

apiOperation.shortdesc: This handler is invoked upon either success or failure of the Task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
This handler is invoked upon either success or failure of the Task. It can be used for cleanup that must be done regardless of Task-status.
This method may be called multiple times safely. Each unique function specified will be executed once when the task is ready for cleanup.
This type of closure should implement the following signature: function():void

apiOperation.shortdesc: Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate starting, this method may also be used for notification purposes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate starting, this method may also be used for notification purposes. The provided function will be invoked each time the task is started (or re-started).
This method may be called multiple times safely; each unique function specified will be executed once when the task starts.
It should have the following signature: function():void

apiValue.shortdesc: Optional data parameter passed to the Task complete/error/interruption method.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current task failed.

apiValue.shortdesc: The task is currently running.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The task is currently running. This value is FALSE if the task has not been run, has completed run (succesfully or due to a failure), or has been interrupted.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Number of internal operations conducted by this task. Sub-classes should override this method if containing a value > 1;
If value > 1, task should dispatch ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events manually to indicate changes in numInternalOperationsCompleted. If value == 1, task will automatically dispatching ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Sleeps until told to complete.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Sleeps until told to complete. This Task can be inserted into a composite to block for an indeterminate amount of time. Since this Task is simple a placeholder, it supports interruptibility.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Stop sleeping and complete Task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Stop sleeping and complete Task.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Decorates a Task returned by the specified factory method.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Decorates a Task returned by the specified factory method. This Task does not invoke the provided factory method until it is actually executed. This allows for just-in-time evaluation of data set by previous Tasks.

apiParam.apiDesc: Optional object to which the function is applied.
Optional Array of parameters to be passed to the factory Function. If this value is specified a target "thisObj" must be provided as well.
Task returned by facotry function is interruptible
Semantically meaningful task identifier (useful for automated testing or debugging)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiValue.shortdesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiValue.shortdesc: If this FactoryTask is re-run after an error has occurred, this attribute controls whether it: (a) Reuses the decorated Task initially created during its first run, or (b) Reexecutes the factory method to create a new decorated Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
If this FactoryTask is re-run after an error has occurred, this attribute controls whether it: (a) Reuses the decorated Task initially created during its first run, or (b) Reexecutes the factory method to create a new decorated Task.
By default this value is FALSE, meaning that the decorated task created initially will be reused.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Decorates a Task but re-dispatches both error and success events as success.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Decorates a Task but re-dispatches both error and success events as success. This type of decorator should be used for Tasks that are required and are blocking, but should not be considered fatal in the event of a failure.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Interrupt the current Task.

apiReturn.apiDesc: TRUE if the Task has been successfully interrupted

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interrupt the current Task. Interruptions should be handled in such a way as to allow a subsequent call to run() to resume gracefully.
This mehtod should trigger an event of type TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Resets the task to it's pre-run state.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Resets the task to it's pre-run state. This allows it to be re-run. This method can only be called on non-running tasks.

apiValue.shortdesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Inner (decorated) Task.

apiValue.shortdesc: The current task has successfully completed execution.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current task has successfully completed execution.

apiValue.shortdesc: The task is currently running.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The task is currently running. This value is FALSE if the task has not been run, has completed run (succesfully or due to a failure), or has been interrupted.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This class is meant to encapsulate a single, self-contained job.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This class is meant to encapsulate a single, self-contained job. Each instance can have 0+ dependencies in the form of other tasks.
To create a usable Task, extend this class and override the customRun() method. Your Task should call taskComplete() or taskError() when it has completed or failed.

apiParam.apiDesc: Human-friendly ID string useful for debugging purposes only.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Executes the specified tasks when the current task is executed.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Executes the specified tasks when the current task is executed. If the current task has already been started the new tasks will be executed immediately. Failures or interruptions in the current task will not affect the chained tasks.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a string for logging the specified task-state event.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns a string for logging the specified task-state event.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Interrupts the current Task to wait on the Task specified.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interrupts the current Task to wait on the Task specified. Once this Task dispatches a TaskEvent.COMPLETE event, this Task will resume. If the specified Task dispatches a TaskEvent.ERROR event this Task will also error. TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED events are ignored.
If this method is called once with a Task and then called again before that Task has completed, Event listeners will be removed from the first Task and added to the second one. There can only be 1 active interrupting Task at a time. If this Task should be interrupted by more than one Task, a CompositeTask or ObserverTask should be used.
If the specified interrupting Task is already running this method will simply add event listeners. If it is not running this method will add event listeners but will rely on external code to run the interrupter.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Interruptible tasks should override interrupt() and get interruptible() if they are interruptible.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Interruptible tasks should override interrupt() and get interruptible() if they are interruptible.
If they are, they should fire a TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED to indicate successful interruption of the task.
If the interrupting fails at runtime, this method returns false

apiOperation.shortdesc: Executes the specified tasks if the current task fails.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Executes the specified tasks if the current task fails.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Resets the task to it's pre-run state.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Resets the task to it's pre-run state. This allows it to be re-run. This method can only be called on non-running tasks.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Starts a task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Starts a task. This method will dispatch a TaskEvent.STARTED to indicate that the task has begun.
This method may also be used to retry/resume an errored task.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method should be called upon Task completion.

apiParam.apiDesc: An (optional) message or data in string form
Optional data object related to the Task dispatching this event.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method should be called upon Task completion. It dispatches a TaskEvent.COMPLETE event and toggles the Tasks's "running" and "complete" states. It also invokes the success handler if one has been provided.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method should be called upon Task failure.

apiParam.apiDesc: Optional data object containing additional error information

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This method should be called upon Task failure. It dispatches a TaskEvent.ERROR event and toggles the Tasks's "running" and "complete" states. It also invokes the error handler if one has been provided.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Call this method to interrupt the currently running Task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Call this method to interrupt the currently running Task. This method dispatches a TaskEvent.INTERRUPTED and toggles the tasks's "running" state.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Executes the specified tasks once the current task has completed successfully.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Executes the specified tasks once the current task has completed successfully.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate completion, this method may also be used for notification purposes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate completion, this method may also be used for notification purposes. The provided function will be invoked only upon successful completion of the task.
This method may be called multiple times safely; each unique function specified will be executed once when the task completes.
It should have one of the following signatures: function( message:String = "", data:= null ):void function():void

apiOperation.shortdesc: Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate failure, this method may also be used for notification purposes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate failure, this method may also be used for notification purposes. The provided function will be invoked only upon failure of the task.
This method may be called multiple times safely; each unique function specified will be executed once if the tasks errors.
It should have one of the following signatures: function( message:String = "", data:= null ):void function():void

apiOperation.shortdesc: This handler is invoked upon either success or failure of the Task.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
This handler is invoked upon either success or failure of the Task. It can be used for cleanup that must be done regardless of Task-status.
This method may be called multiple times safely. Each unique function specified will be executed once when the task is ready for cleanup.
This type of closure should implement the following signature: function():void

apiOperation.shortdesc: Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate starting, this method may also be used for notification purposes.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Although tasks dispatch TaskEvents to indicate starting, this method may also be used for notification purposes. The provided function will be invoked each time the task is started (or re-started).
This method may be called multiple times safely; each unique function specified will be executed once when the task starts.
It should have the following signature: function():void

If value > 1, task should dispatch ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events manually to indicate changes in numInternalOperationsCompleted. If value == 1, task will automatically dispatching ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiValue.shortdesc: Unique ID for a task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Unique ID for a task.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Convenience Task that listens to an IEventDispatcher for either a success or failure type event.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Convenience Task that listens to an IEventDispatcher for either a success or failure type event.
This Task can be used within a composite to block on the dispatching of an event. It saves users from creating custom Tasks just to handle event listening.
This task can be interrupted, though interrupting it will not stop (or affect) the IEventDispatcher it monitors. Events dispatched while this task is in an interrupted state will be queued and handled when the task is resumed.
If multiple Events are dispatched, only the first one will be responded-to / observed.
Upon completion of this Task the Event that triggered the completion will be accessible via the "data" propery.

apiParam.apiDesc: One or more event types indicating success (String or Array)
One or more event types indicating failure (String or Array)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to perform any custom reset operations.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Observes (but does not execute) a collection of Tasks.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Observes (but does not execute) a collection of Tasks. This task can be used to monitor the execution of 1 or more running Tasks. Tasks can be added (or removed) while the observer is running. It will complete only once all observed Tasks has completed.
If any of the observed Tasks errors, the observer will error as well if failUponError is TRUE. In this case the observer will re-dispatch the "data" and "message" properties of the first Task to fail. If failUponError is FALSE, observed Task errors and complets will be treated the same.
If this Task is executed with no observed Tasks it will instantly complete. The same is true if all of its observed Tasks have already completed by the time it has been executed.

apiParam.apiDesc: Controls behavior in the event of a Task error; see class documentation for more detail

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Add an additional Task to the set of Tasks being observed.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Remove the specified Task from the set of Tasks being observed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Number of internal operations conducted by this task. Sub-classes should override this method if containing a value > 1;
If value > 1, task should dispatch ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events manually to indicate changes in numInternalOperationsCompleted. If value == 1, task will automatically dispatching ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events.

apiValue.shortdesc: Array of Tasks currently observed by this Task.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Array of Tasks currently observed by this Task.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Interruptible stub Task primarily intended for use in the context of automated tests.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Interruptible stub Task primarily intended for use in the context of automated tests. This Task does nothing when run (nor when interrupted) other than increment the Task counter. It can be manually completed or errored at any point using the complete and error methods.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Task that invokes a specified function upon execution.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Task that invokes a specified function upon execution. The function invoked will retain the scope of where it was defined, allowing for easy access to other class/method variables.
This type of Task can be asynchronous. It will not complete (or error) until specifically instructed to do so. This instruction should be triggered as a result of the custom function it executes.

apiParam.apiDesc: Function to be executed when this Task is run
If TRUE this Task will complete after running custom function (unless custom function called "errorTask")
Semantically meaningful task identifier (useful for automated testing or debugging)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method to give your Task functionality.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Instructs Task to dispatch an error event.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Instructs Task to dispatch an error event.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Instructs Task to complete itself.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Instructs Task to complete itself.

apiValue.shortdesc: If TRUE this Task will synchronously complete itself once it has invoked its custom run function.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: If TRUE this Task will synchronously complete itself once it has invoked its custom run function. If an error occurs during the functions execution however the Task will not dispatch a redundant complete event.

apiValue.shortdesc: Function to be executed when this Task is run

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Function to be executed when this Task is run

apiValue.shortdesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The current task can be executed synchronously.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Decorates a non-interruptible Task and adds interruptible-like behavior.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Decorates a non-interruptible Task and adds interruptible-like behavior. This task does not actually stop and resume the decorated Task, But it does prevent ERROR or COMPLETE events from being dispatched when in an interrupted state. Should ERROR or COMPLETE occur while interrupted they will be re-dispatched upon resume.
This Task-type also re-dispatches any ProgressEvents dispatched by the decorated Task.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sub-classes should override this method to implement interruption behavior (removing event listeners, pausing objects, etc.).

If value > 1, task should dispatch ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events manually to indicate changes in numInternalOperationsCompleted. If value == 1, task will automatically dispatching ProgressEvent.PROGRESS events.
